intro: Astracantha bombycalyx, commonly known as the silky spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
